answers.answer: You have classic symptoms of POTS (Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome) I'm surprised your doctors did not pursue this diagnosis.Also suspicion of hypothyroidism.It's a vicious cycle, malabsorption of iron-thyroid function depends on adequate levels of iron- and  low thyroid affects digestion and G/I functions, perpetuating your low iron status and anemiaYou may need to change doctors.Best wishes,Niko.
POTS  is a valid concern.  go to doc....ask about pots.  thyroid problems makes anything else you have worse.  your diabetes is always a problem whenever anything else is wrong...God bless...

question: So I began to get sick around 18 months ago now and no doctor can give me a clear answer for my symptoms and even dismissimy some of them.Symptoms are:Fluctuations between constipation and diarrhoea (mostly the latter)dull and achey stomach painsnausea (mostly in the morning)Chronic exhaustiondizziness upon standingheadachesunexplained heart rate increase when standing (95bpm to 125 or as high as 140 nom)Confusion and forgetfullNessmassive fluctuations in blood sugar (including hospital admittance for DKA)anaemiaThe main answer I'm getting is IBS induced by anxieity.A bit about me: I'm a 22 year old female with type 1 diabetes. I don't drink. I smoke less than a cigarette a day. prior to this I worked as a chef, I've been off work on sickness for a while and have now taKen a part time job in a coffee shop which I struggle to do.I'm at a loss. I hope someone can help
title: 18 months of no results
